name: Semantic Energy Axiom
intent: Define semantic energy as a conserved or trackable quantity associated with semantic wave dynamics.
constraints: Given a semantic wave equation d²/dt² r \+ L r \= 0, define E\[r\] \= 1/2 (||ṙ||^2 \+ ⟨r, L r⟩).
If L is self-adjoint and the system is undamped, then d/dt E\[r\] \= 0 (semantic energy conservation).
Under external forcing f(t), the change in energy satisfies E\[r\](t1) \- E\[r\](t0) \= ∫\_{t0}^{t1} ⟨f(t), ṙ(t)⟩ dt.
Semantic work is defined as the integral of forcing against semantic velocity.
